intro: Malope stipulacea var. asterotricha, commonly known as the woolly yellowcress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It has a low-growing habit with branched stems and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. The species is part of the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
